conclusion: Analyze the behavior of light in a transparent medium with a hollow center.
The beam of light is composed of red light, green light, and purple light.
The red light is incident at an angle of i = 45°.
The green light is just tangent to the inner wall of the ball.
The purple light is refracted in the transparent material.
The ratio of the radius of the hollow part to the radius of the ball is 1:2.
The radius of the hollow part is half the radius of the ball.
The radius of the ball is 2r and the radius of the hollow part is r.
The refractive index of the transparent material can be calculated using the formula n = (1 + sin²θ) / (1 - sin²θ).
For the red light, the angle of incidence is 45°.
The refractive index of the red light is n_red = 3.
The angle of incidence for the green light is 45°.
The refractive index of the green light is n_green = 3.
The angle of incidence for the purple light is 45°.
The refractive index of the purple light is n_purple = 3.
The speed of light in a vacuum is c.
The speed of light in the transparent material is v = n_D c.
Since the refractive indices of the red, green, and purple light are all 3, the refractive index of D light is also 3.
The speed of D light in the transparent material is v = 3c.
